reg:regulation.reg:title: Forgiveness of Student Loans Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 144/2015, July 24, 2015]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: branch means the Student Services Branch of the Ministry of Advanced Education;

student loan means a debt or obligation to the government owed by a student as a result of a loan, including a direct loan, guaranteed loan and risk shared loan, made to the student under StudentAid BC.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to section 3, all or part of a student loan may be forgiven by the following persons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Deputy Minister of Advanced Education;
the executive director of the branch if, in respect of the student loan, the total amount of principal and interest forgiven is not more than $40 000;
a director of the branch if, in respect of the student loan, the total amount of principal and interest forgiven is not more than $20 000.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 2, this regulation applies only to student loans in respect of the following programs:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the British Columbia Access Grant for Labour Market Priorities;
the British Columbia Completion Grant for Graduates;
the British Columbia Loan Forgiveness Program;
the British Columbia Loan Remission Program;
the British Columbia Severe Permanent Disability Benefit;
the Pacific Leaders British Columbia Loan Forgiveness Program.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Financial Administration Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c.138, section 18 (2)]
